termsPage.metaDescription: Read the terms and conditions governing the use of our legalization services.
termsPage.legalNotice: Important: Our services are provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis without any guarantees regarding processing times, outcomes or acceptance. Processing is controlled by third parties (embassies/consulates, notaries public, chambers of commerce, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, translators). Delays, rejections or additional requirements from these parties are outside our control and do not entitle you to compensation.

general.title: General Information
general.text: These Terms and Conditions ("Terms") govern the use of Legalization Service AB ("we", "us" or "our") services. By using our services, you agree to these Terms. Our services are provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, whether express or implied. The Terms apply from the moment you accept them prior to placing an order.

services.title: Service Description
services.text: We provide legalization services for documents intended for use abroad. This includes handling documents, communication with relevant authorities, embassies and other entities, as well as shipping of documents. We do not guarantee processing times, outcomes or acceptance. Processing and decisions are made by third parties (embassies/consulates, notaries public, chambers of commerce, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, translators).

customer.title: Customer Responsibilities
customer.intro: As a customer, you are responsible for:

items.1: Specifying the correct destination and legalization requirements
items.2: Paying for the services as agreed
items.3: Verifying that all information is correct before placing the order

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.intro: We are only responsible for the services we have undertaken to perform in accordance with these Terms. To the maximum extent permitted by law, we exclude all liability for delays, rejections, changes in requirements or other actions by third parties.

items.0: No guarantee of processing times, outcomes or acceptance; timelines are indicative only
items.1: Third-party actions (embassies/consulates, notaries, chambers, MFA, translators) are outside our control and at their sole discretion
items.2: Our total liability is limited to fees paid to us for the specific service; we are not liable for indirect, special or consequential damages

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.text: All prices are excluding VAT unless otherwise stated. Prices may change with prior notice.

cancellation.title: Cancellation and Refunds
cancellation.text: Orders can be cancelled free of charge within 24 hours from the time of ordering, provided that processing has not started. Official fees, courier costs and other third‚Äëparty charges may be non‚Äërefundable once incurred.

forceMajeure.title: Force Majeure
forceMajeure.text: We are not responsible for delays caused by circumstances beyond our control.

law.title: Governing Law
law.text: These Terms are governed by Swedish law. Any disputes shall be resolved by Swedish courts.

changes.title: Changes to the Terms
changes.text: We reserve the right to change these Terms. Changes will be announced on our website.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.text: If you have questions about these Terms, please contact us.

cookiesPage.metaDescription: Information about our use of cookies in accordance with EU ePrivacy Directive and GDPR.
cookiesPage.title: Cookies
cookiesPage.intro: We use cookies to ensure the website functions correctly, to improve your experience and to analyze how our site is used. This page explains what cookies are, which types we use and how you can manage your choices.

whatAre.title: What are cookies?
whatAre.text: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They help the site remember your preferences and enable important functionality such as security, session handling and language settings.

types.title: Types of cookies we use
types.intro: We use the following categories of cookies:
types.necessaryDesc: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be disabled. They are used for basic functions such as security and accessibility.
types.analyticsDesc: Help us understand how visitors use our site so we can improve it. The information is used for statistical purposes only.
types.functionalDesc: Enable remembering your choices and improving your experience, for example by saving your language settings.

consent.title: Your consent and choices
consent.text1: Under EU rules (ePrivacy/GDPR) we obtain your consent for non‚Äëessential cookies. You can accept all, decline all or choose only essential cookies via our cookie banner.
consent.text2: You can change or withdraw your consent at any time via cookie settings (usually available in the footer) or by clearing cookies in your browser.

hero.title: Document legalization for use abroad
hero.subtitle: We help you with apostille, notarization, and embassy legalization. Fast, easy, and secure.

services.pageIntro: We offer a range of document legalization services to meet your needs

apostille.title: Apostille
apostille.description: Legalization of documents for use in countries that are part of the Hague Convention
apostille.longDescription: Apostille is a simplified certification process for documents that will be used in countries that are part of the 1961 Hague Convention. This certification verifies the authenticity of the signature, the capacity in which the person signing the document acted, and the identity of any stamp or seal on the document.

notarization.title: Notarization
notarization.description: Notarization of documents by a notary public for legal validity
notarization.longDescription: Notarization is the process where a notary public certifies and attests to the authenticity of signatures on documents. This service is often required for legal documents, affidavits, and other important papers to verify their legitimacy and prevent fraud.

embassy.title: Embassy Legalization
embassy.description: Legalization of documents through embassy or consulate for use in specific countries
embassy.longDescription: Embassy legalization is required for documents that will be used in countries that are not part of the Hague Convention. This process involves getting your documents certified by the embassy or consulate of the country where they will be used, after they have been authenticated by the appropriate authorities in your home country.

translation.title: Authorized Translation
translation.description: Translation of documents by authorized translators for official use
translation.longDescription: Our authorized translation service provides official translations of your documents by certified translators. These translations are legally recognized and can be used for official purposes such as immigration, education, business, and legal matters in foreign countries.

ud.title: Foreign Ministry Legalization
ud.description: Legalization of documents by the Swedish Ministry for Foreign Affairs
ud.longDescription: This service involves the legalization of documents by the Swedish Ministry for Foreign Affairs (UD). This is often required as a step before embassy legalization or for documents that need official government verification for use abroad.

chamber.title: Chamber of Commerce Legalization
chamber.description: Legalization of commercial documents through the Chamber of Commerce

testimonials.title: What our customers say
testimonials.subtitle: Here are some testimonials from our satisfied customers

person1.name: Anna Johansson
person1.content: Amazing service! I needed to get my documents legalized quickly for a business trip to China and everything went smoothly and professionally.

person2.name: Erik Svensson
person2.content: I needed to get my diploma apostilled for studies abroad. The process was simple and the staff was very helpful in explaining all the steps.

person3.name: Maria Lindgren
person3.content: As a lawyer, I really appreciate the thoroughness and professionalism that Legalization Service shows in their work. Highly recommended!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our legalization services
faq.question1: What is the difference between apostille and embassy legalization?
faq.answer1: Apostille is a simplified legalization process for countries that are part of the 1961 Hague Convention. Embassy legalization is required for countries that are not part of the convention and involves legalizing the document through the specific country's embassy or consulate.
faq.question2: How long does the legalization process take?
faq.answer2: The standard process typically takes 5-7 business days for apostille and 7-14 business days for embassy legalization. We also offer express services for urgent matters.
faq.answer3: We can help with the legalization of most types of documents, including academic certificates, birth certificates, marriage certificates, company documents, powers of attorney, and many other official documents.
faq.question4: Do I need to send original documents?
faq.answer4: Yes, original documents are usually required for legalization. In some cases, notarized copies may be accepted. Contact us for specific advice for your case.
faq.answer5: Yes, once your order has been confirmed, you will receive an order number that you can use to track the status of your order via our order status page.
faq.moreQuestions: Can't find the answer to your question?

about.title: About Us
about.description: Learn more about Legalization Service and our work with document legalization for international use.
about.missionText: Legalization Service is your reliable partner for document legalization. We simplify the process of making your documents valid for international use by offering professional services in apostille, notarization and embassy legalization.
about.missionText2: Our goal is to make the often complicated legalization process as simple and stress-free as possible for our customers, whether you are an individual, company or organization.
about.experienceText: With many years of experience in document management and international legalization, we have helped thousands of customers get their documents correctly legalized for use in over 100 countries worldwide.
about.experienceText2: Our team of experts has deep knowledge of different countries' requirements and conventions, ensuring that your documents are handled correctly according to applicable international standards.
about.qualityText: We always prioritize quality and security in our work. All our processes follow strict quality standards and we only use certified and authorized services to ensure that your documents are correctly legalized.
about.qualityText2: Your privacy and document security are of the highest priority to us. We handle all documents with the utmost care and follow all applicable data protection regulations.
about.contactText: Do you have questions about our services or need help with legalization of your documents? Don't hesitate to contact us.
